docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and his campaign are arguing that the Romney-Ryan approach to Medicare would leave older Americans vulnerable to rising health care costs.

headline.seo: In Poll, Obama Opens Medicare Edge Over Romney
headline.main: Challenged on Medicare, G.O.P. Loses Ground
headline.print_headline: Challenged on Medicare, G.O.P. Loses Ground

docs.abstract: One of the biggest challenges facing the Republican ticket is countering the Democrats' longstanding advantage as the party more trusted to deal with Medicare; Pres Obama and his campaign have been making the case that Mitt Romney's approach to Medicare would leave older Americans vulnerable to rising health care costs, and polls seem to suggest that the strategy is working.
docs.snippet: President Obama and his campaign are arguing that the Romney-Ryan approach to Medicare would leave older Americans vulnerable to rising health care costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitch White, a former N.F.L. player, must learn to adjust his life to the effects of a brain injury. He joins more than 3,000 players suing the N.F.L. over concussions.

headline.seo: Former N.F.L. Player Mitch White Learns to Adjust To Postconcussion Life
headline.main: A Player’s Concussion, a Family’s Ordeal
headline.print_headline: A Player’s Concussion, A Family’s Ordeal

docs.abstract: Profile of Mitch White, a former NFL player who is dealing with long-term effects of brain injury; White is one of more than 3,000 players suing the NFL over concussions.
docs.snippet: Mitch White, a former N.F.L. player, must learn to adjust his life to the effects of a brain injury. He joins more than 3,000 players suing the N.F.L. over concussions.

docs.lead_paragraph: ''At some point you have to move to the next generation.'' Philip W. Schiller, Apple's senior vice president for worldwide marketing, as the company released the iPhone 5. The company got rid of the traditional dock connector for attaching the new phone to peripherals, meaning that people who want to use their existing iPhone accessories will have to buy an adapter from Apple.

headline.main: Small Business Health Insurance: Costs Still Going Up

docs.abstract: For many, the real impact of the Affordable Care Act, should it survive, is still two years away.

docs.lead_paragraph: A presidential candidate who is not short of campaign promises is specific on some proposals, but vague on others.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney Remains Vague on Details of Some Proposals
headline.main: Some Romney Proposals Await Fuller Detail
headline.print_headline: Some Romney Proposals Await Fuller Detail

docs.abstract: Vagueness of some of the policy proposals coming out of Mitt Romney presidential campaigns policy has been brought up not just by Democrats, but also by his fellow Republicans and some conservative-leaning publications.
docs.snippet: A presidential candidate who is not short of campaign promises is specific on some proposals, but vague on others.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in California have begun to set up an online marketplace where millions of residents will be able to shop for medical coverage.

headline.seo: California Tries to Lead Way on Health Law
headline.main: California Tries to Guide the Way on Health Law
headline.print_headline: California Tries To Guide Way On Health Law

docs.abstract: California, home to seven million uninsured people, is at the forefront of preparations for a controversial component of the new health care law that will soon require most Americans to have medical coverage or pay a penalty; state officials have begun to set up an online marketplace where millions of residents will be able to shop for medical coverage.
docs.snippet: Officials in California have begun to set up an online marketplace where millions of residents will be able to shop for medical coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shares on Wall Street closed higher a day after the Federal Reserve gave a green light to big asset purchases to boost the American economy.

headline.main: Fed Action Keeps Rally Going for a 4th Day
headline.print_headline: Fed Action Keeps Rally Going for a 4th Day

docs.abstract: Stock indexes rise for a fourth consecutive session, closing out the week at nearly five-year highs after the Federal Reserve took bold action to spur the economy.
docs.snippet: Shares on Wall Street closed higher a day after the Federal Reserve gave a green light to big asset purchases to boost the American economy.
